intro: Cacalia syncephala, commonly known as the pink evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the tribe Physaleae within the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Cacalia syncephala is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
